subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: Ptolemy's World Map
description: A fast breakdown of Ptolemy's World Map for builders.

hook.text: Ptolemy's world map from 150 AD shaped geography for 1,400 years â€” and it was full of errors.

buildup.text: The Greek astronomer created a coordinate system using latitude and longitude, a breakthrough in mapping.

discovery.text: His map showed Europe, Africa, and Asia. The Americas and Australia were completely missing.

twist.text: He made the Indian Ocean a closed sea and shrank Earth's size by 30%. Columbus used this wrong number.

climax.text: Columbus thought Asia was close because Ptolemy's map said so. He sailed west expecting Japan, not America.

punchline.text: A 1,400-year-old mistake led Columbus to the wrong continent.

quiz.question: How did Ptolemy's error affect Columbus?
options: Columbus thought Asia was closer than it was
